results.title: Our children : Video package
results.creator_credit: Rachel Dixon, Film Victoria and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A Child Protection Package to train professionals who are in regular contact with children. Divided into 5 segments: 1: Defining abuse 2:Difficulties in reporting 3:Early detection and support 4:Networking for information exchange and case management 5:On-going responsibility for prevention, protection and support between family, CSV and professionals. Accompanied by 43p. Leader’s Guide including 8 overhead transparencies. The Leader’s Guide should be used in conjunction with the video. It gives background information as well as discussion questions and issues relevant to each segment.

results.title: Our changing earth. Part 2. Wearing away of the land
results.brief_description: Many forces wear away the land, but what is worn away in one place goes to build up in another. Shows how rocks are decomposed; how caves and sink holes are made; and how glaciers are formed and the work they do; how blowing sand erodes the surface of the earth; and how the waves are reshaping the coastline.

results.title: Our changing earth. Part 1. The Earth's rocky crust
results.creator_credit: Harvard Film Service, Harvard University and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Physiography is presented as a dynamic process: the forces which have shaped the earth as it is today are still at work changing it further. The part played by the water cycle in determining the physiography of the earth is emphasised, and the formation of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks is illustrated by models and by animated diagrams.
results.title_for_label: Our changing earth. Part 1. The Earth’s rocky crust
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harvard Film Service, Harvard University and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Our changing cities - can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A short history of the development of cities in the United States. Accounts for the social forces and movements which have shaped modern cities, and describes city life of the past and present. Designed for children.

results.title: Our century: invaders
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Mark Hamlyn, Will Davies, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, Film Australia, Australian Film Commission and Nine Network
results.brief_description: This episode from ‘Our Century’ and hosted by Ray Martin examines the infestations that have cursed Australia since white settlement. It covers issues such as why some animals and insects were introduced and how we now deal with their devastating effects on the environment.

results.title: Otway countdown
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Don Dennett and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A student production making a clear statement of the conservationists viewpoint of clearfelling and woodchopping of valuable native forests. It examines the history of the Otways and argues strongly against current practices. This film could be used in conjunction with films and resources giving the alternative viewpoints to stimulate debate on resource management.

results.title: Otto: zoo gorilla
results.creator_credit: Dugan Rosalini and Dugan Rosalini Film Associates
results.brief_description: Focuses on the move of the great apes to new quarters in Chicago’s Lincoln Park Zoo, providing a view of animals in captivity and a new perspective on zoos.

results.title: Otto Messmer and Felix the Cat
results.brief_description: Presents a tribute to Otto Messmer and his famous cartoon character, Felix the Cat. Features the cartoonist, who describes the evolution of Felix’s personality, and includes excerpts from five vintage shorts starring Felix the Cat. Music by Ross Care. Camera by Richard W. Adams. Written by John Canemaker.

results.title: Ottawa: reflection of a nation
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Canada and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Canada’s capital city is viewed here in its spring-time splendour. A colorful parade of the Guards on Parliament Hill, the escort of an ambassador in coach-and-four, and away from the pageantry the wildlife refuge of Gatineau Park are featured.
